about_the_game:
Dive into the cosy world of Kamata, where you'll join Nia on a quest to clean up waste that's clogging her beautiful island of Zimzemba. Help Nia recycle trash, earn some pocket money, make friends, upgrade her equipment to tackle new challenges, and uncover the mystery of who is behind the massive pollution. Kamata offers an impactful experience for players looking to make a difference in our environment and climate while enjoying a sunny adventure on the Swahili coast.

Gameplay Features

  • Collect and Recycle: Pick up rubbish around the island, recycle bottles for refunds, and compost organic waste to restore Zimzemba’s health.

  • Explore and Upgrade: As you level up, unlock new ways to explore the island, including gliders and pedal boats, to access hidden areas and clean up even more waste.

  • Puzzles and Mysteries: Uncover secrets and solve puzzles to find out who is responsible for polluting Zimzemba.

  • Learn and Advocate: Discover more about recycling, composting, climate change, and the balance between individual actions and community efforts.

  • Engage with Rich Narratives: Meet diverse characters, learn about Swahili culture and language, and build connections that make your efforts to clean the island more meaningful.

What You Can Expect from Kamata

  • A cosy game set on the beautiful Swahili coast with an inclusive, strong female protagonist.

  • A rich, narrative-driven experience exploring themes of environmental conservation.

  • Stunning tropical visuals and a vibrant island filled with unique flora and fauna.

  • An immersive soundtrack by Ashley Wearne, capturing the sounds of the Indian Ocean.

Story and Setting

Join Nia, who sets out to clean up the trash that’s washed up on the island of Zimzemba. Initially motivated by the promise of pocket money to buy Baba a birthday present, Nia soon realises that her efforts can make a real impact on the environment. As the island becomes healthier, more birds and wildlife return, and Nia's sense of purpose deepens. Guided by the strong values of her community, she uncovers a larger mystery about the pollution threatening her home.

Target Audience

Kamata is perfect for young gamers, cosy game enthusiasts, and players who want to experience a different culture while actively contributing to saving a slice of paradise.
